name: market for dimethyldichlorosilane | dimethyldichlorosilane | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/16804/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'dimethyldichlorosilane', in the Global geography.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;dimethyldichlorosilane'  is an organic substance with a CAS no. : 000075-78-5. It is called 'dichloro(dimethyl)silane' under IUPAC naming and its molecular formula is: C2H6Cl2Si. It is liquid under normal conditions of temperature and pressure and appears as a colour less, fuming liquid with a pungent odour. It is soluble in benzene and ether, but decomposes in water and ethanol. It is modelled as a pure substance.  There is no publicly available information about the consumption of this substance on a consumer level. On industrial sites, the substance is used for the manufacture of products in the following sectors: chemicals, mainly to produce silicones.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'dimethyldichlorosilane',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of 'dimethyldichlorosilane',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
